project.name: analyze
project.description:
Runs javadoc, checkstyle, pmd, findbugs, sclc, emma (and junit implicitly via emma), generating reports and HackyStat data for each tool. Unlike verify, analyze does NOT abort if a tool finds errors, it just keeps on running the rest of the tools. analyze is more useful than verify for interactive use since it runs reports and doesn't stop at the first problem.
Invocation: ant -f analyze.build.xml.

target.name: analyze
target.depends: clean, compile, javadoc, checkstyle, pmd, findbugs, sclc, emma, junit.report, junit.sensor
target.description: Invoke analyzers, generate reports, DO NOT fail if any errors found.
